Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Blindly \Blind"ly\, adv. Without sight, discernment, or understanding; without thought, investigation, knowledge, or purpose of one's own. [1913 Webster]
By his imperious mistress blindly led. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
blindly adv 1: without seeing or looking; "he felt around his desk blindly" 2: without preparation or reflection; without a rational basis; "they bought the car blindly"; "he picked a wife blindly"
